comment: Terrible experience. Grading was unclear and expectations were all over the place. Assignments were confusing with little guidance, and it was nearly impossible to get in touch with her for help. The class felt disorganized from start to finish. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Group projects

comment: This course was a breeze. I don't know why all the reviews says she's bad, she was just fine. She responded to emails, was available for meetings, and gave overall good feedback. The course was pretty much one of those online textbook courses (kinda like one of those Mcgraw Hill courses). Group project was okay. Easy A overall. Good Professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Least favorite teacher/class I've had at KSU.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: She is an easy grader but BEWARE if you take her class, you will be very frustrated. She does not email back in a timely manner. She does not teach the material, so I hope you know how to do everything going in. She is the worst teacher I have ever had. You can easily get an A but be prepared to be frustrated the whole semester.
rating_tags: Group projects

comment: I recommend this professor for is200!!!
She is an incredibly easy grader on weekly assignments/discussions. The Mid-term and final is any easy A, its open note!
I don't why this professor has low rating, but you actually learn things from the real business world and its a easy A if you follow the requirement.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Take her you won't regret!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: This class is probably the easier than any other business courses that I have taken because its any easy A..!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Easy on grading, midterm and final open note, and there be no reason why you didnt make any A in this class!!

She is pretty nice and gives out easy grades. I would definitely recommend her if you are someone who just wants to pass the class and get it over with. You dont even have to show up, just do the assignments, submit them, and you'll pass.
This is a difficult class, but any easy A..
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Dembla really wants her students to do well in the course. Her instructions are vague but if you email her to clarify she will and that helped me. Lots of assignments and quizzes start early.
Take good notes and this class is a easy A!

I enjoyed this course very much. I took his class during the summer so the semester was shortened. While the class was very fast-paced I was able to understand what we were learning. Review the notes they are very helpful and they have all the information you will need for the exams. I would recommend this class to any new students at KSU.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: No interaction, but I will take this course as a GPA booster!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Theres a group project, excel, powerpoint, and word document. The midterm and the final is the easiest part because it's not lockdown or web cammed. By far the easiest A that you can get!!! Her grading is easy, but she will not reply your email until a week or two later.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: By far, the easiest professor that you can get!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: BEWARE OF THE PROJECTS, everything else is a easy A!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: I learned a lot in this class, even though this course is not tough!! You should take this professor..
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: This class is a easy A because she only grades 2 times a semester and I don't think she cares about her job!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: She does not teach, but trust me its a VERY EASY A!!
Take this class for a easy A!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Discussion posts, and quizzes. This was was interesting and I learned a lot. Its a lot of work, but doesn't feel like it
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: This was a very easy online class, but she only grades two assignments throughout the semester! no test or quizzes..
Take this class its easy A even though she does not teach at all!! Good luck trying to get her to email you back when you have questions about the project..!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Professor Dembla is a really nice person. She is an okay teacher in some aspects and not in others. She takes a long time to grade assignments, always returns feedback after the test where it would've been helpful to know beforehand to study it. However, her class was pretty easy, and I enjoyed her in-person class.

Completely ignored everything she put in the syllabus, and changed everyone's grade because of it. Easy on grading, but good luck trying to get her to reply to you. I had to contact multiple people just to get a reply to one e-mail. She doesn't care about her job, and certainly doesn't care about you. This department is just a mess!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: This was was completely different than one I had taken before. We had a LOT of stuff graded. Assignments with step by step insturctions (easy to follow). Discussion posts, and quizzes. This was was interesting and I learned a lot. Its a lot of work, but doesn't feel like it. For this class, she is a good professor. Not a very tough grader either.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Doesn't ever grade assignments or respond to emails. Uninterested. She has only graded 2-4 assignments this whole semester. But because she procrastinates she grades easy. This is my second time taking her. A+ both times. Easy A.

Class format was a mess, assignments often had incomplete, incorrect, or even contrary instructions which required clarification.  Assignments were all very easy though.  She only graded assignments twice through the whole semester and was terrible at returning email in a timely fashion.  She was very detached and uninvolved, but the class was easy
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Literally takes months to finish grading. Not interested in teaching based on her performance on the dicussion forums. Just collectin a check IMO
rating_tags: GROUP PROJECTS

comment: BEWARE OF GROUP PROJECT!! 10 page paper and presentation w/ audio and extensive notes. Otherwise quizzes were easy. Lots of projects that get thrown at you out of no where and are completely irrelative to the material. They tend to be worth large amounts of points too. Super slow grader, but turned out to be good, because I received high grades.
rating_tags: GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Dembla's class was the easiest A I got in grad school. The workload was about average for a graduate class in the IS program, and there were no tests or quizzes that we had to study for. Want an easy A? Take her class. Actually want to learn? Take another professor. It's that simple.

This class is terrible. Quizzes are very specific and not all the answers are easy to find. The midterm  final are 50 questions long with only 32 minutes to do them. Once again, the answers are not easy to find. She is slow to respond to emails. If you ask a question she just tells you to go to tutoring. Im an A student struggling to keep a B.

Stay away from her online class. She gave is 35 minutes to complete 50 question for the midterm!!! I'm a slower reader when I take exams and didn't have near enough time to complete it. I have more assignments due for this class every week than all of my other four classes combined together. It takes her forever to grade. Stay away from online.
great teacher,
Knowledgeable Professor.  Very nice, interesting.  Good discussions.  Point of class is to teach you, not to fail you.  Not overly concerned with grades.
As I am interested in learing from this class, Prof. Dembla has been extremely helpful and supportive. Examples given were very helpful, email response have been quick.
Took her 4 week summer hybrid class.  Quizzes and exams were open book and online.  Great at answering emails.  Book was boring.  Study quizzes and study guides to do well on tests.

One of the worst teachers I have ever had. Follows the PowerPoint slides religiously, and assigned a single-spaced essay with a barely tenuous relation to the course. I urge any student considering this class to exhaust every alternative to avoid this professor.

Dembla is just another textbook follower that relies on power point to teach. Hard to understand, and thinks she is some kind of expert. All she's ever done is light business work at a electronic cable manufacturer. She's the last person I'd listen to in the real world. Her opinions are merely textbook responses with some bad accents thrown in.

Worst teacher as far as knowledge base goes, yet it was one of the easiet classes I took. She has NO REAL WORLD EXPERIENCE at all and would say things like "scientific scientists." People thought she was speaking a different language. Tests come STRAIGHT from the powerpoint. DON'T NEED THE BOOK. Easy semester project that boosts grade. Easy A!

Dembla has no real world experience in the field, so be prepared for an adventure in powerpoint land. Monotone voice gets old fast. Useless fake projects with zero real world examples. I hate to say it, but she's a hack. Needs to really dig into the books and learn a few things herself, or stick to teaching freshmen who don't know any better. 3/10

If you like being bombarded with bulleted lists and repetitive diagrams, then this is the class for you. Nothing but powerpoints and book reading on an insanely boring topic. There's also a maddening group project that spans the entire semester. She's a nice lady, but this class and the way she teaches it are just not that great.
Great Professor!!!!!

Stay engaged, participate in class, show some honest effort and you should be fine. Tests weren't hard, but they covered the material, so do the reading. I really liked her, and think she's cute as a button.

Group Project that wasnt so bad. She does call on people in class so pay attention! Shes really nice unless she notices that you dont pay attention and cant answer any of the questions she asks you. 90% of the time she will let out early! Tests are very simple. Just make sure you study the powerpoint slides!

Very enjoyable professor, has helped me overall in college more than any other as far as my greater concern. Very knowledgable in the material considering she's certified in PMI.She also went alot out of her way to ensure i was on track and understanding the material. Highly recommended and make sure you talk in class or bet on having a quiz.

Amazing professor as far as Project Mgmt is concerned! Has real world working knowledge and is PMI certified. As as CSIS 4830 (IS Integrated Project) not so much, first time teacher, doesn't quite understand the syntax but tries her damndest to be available and to help where at all possible! You MUST talk & resond in class to get on her good side.

Has obviously had no real experience working in IT. This explains the poor real world examples. Taught from the textbook and even admitted having only read the chapter the night before class. Avoid if possible.

This is her 1st semester. She's not at all consistent and her assignments are "sketchy" at best. Openly admits sh's "never taught this class". Examples she uses are elementery and rarely do her demonstrations work/make sense. STAY HOME and Read the book, show up to take tests. If PM is your goal, find another class.
